question: Can cognitive behavioral therapy improve fatigue in cancer patients?
ideal_answer: Yes, it has been documented that cognitive behavioral therapy reduces fatigue symptom severity in cancer patients. In addition,  cognitive behavioral therapy has been also shown to improve mood and overall quality of life, and it can be successfully delivered through a variety of treatment modalities in patients with cancer.
